Comment: From Bloomberg News reporters [David Voreacos](https://www.bloomberg.com/authors/ADjSGtL0H54/david-voreacos) and [Zoe Tillman](https://www.bloomberg.com/authors/AV4iFHxuN3g/zoe-tillman):  A state judge in Wisconsin was arrested Friday by federal agents after an investigation into whether she obstructed an immigration arrest last week.  Milwaukee County Circuit Judge Hannah Dugan was taken into custody Friday morning, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post that was later deleted. She was arrested around 8 a.m. at the county courthouse, according to Brady McCarron, a spokesman for the US Marshals Service.  The FBI had been examining whether Dugan helped an undocumented immigrant avoid arrest, the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel [reported](https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/local/2025/04/23/what-to-know-about-recent-ice-immigration-arrests-at-milwaukee-ozaukee-county-courthouse-wisconsin/83220526007/), citing unidentified sources. Dugan’s clerk declined to comment when reached by Bloomberg News.
Author: bloomberg

Comment: So, she's getting due process?  Why does the 5th amendment apply to her but not to these people who are being kidnapped and removed from the country?  >Fifth Amendment  >No person shall be held to answer for a capital, or otherwise infamous crime, unless on a presentment or indictment of a Grand Jury, except in cases arising in the land or naval forces, or in the Militia, when in actual service in time of War or public danger; nor shall any person be subject for the same offence to be twice put in jeopardy of life or limb; nor shall be compelled in any criminal case to be a witness against himself, nor be deprived of life, liberty, or property, without due process of law; nor shall private property be taken for public use, without just compensation.  I would argue that this judge is following the law as stated in the constitution, but The President and ICE are not.
Author: bluegrassgazer

Comment: Well yeah, everyone get's due process. When you get arrested, they take you to jail and then you see a judge. You're not just given a ticket and then let loose until court.  The fifth amendment is simply the right to remain silent as to not incriminate yourself. She isn't being forced to speak for herself or denied that right. It has nothing to do with a president or ICE, it's simply the right to not speak.  The Fifth Amendment **ensures the protection against self-incrimination**, a fundamental right in the United States legal system. This provision means that individuals cannot be forced to provide evidence or testimony that could be used against them in a criminal case.  Illegal immigrants are not being "kidnapped" that is an emotional blackmail argument, they are being arrested for breaking federal law and subsequently deported as that is the punishment for entering the country illegally.
